Microsoft 365 is more than just Outlook and Word‚Äîit‚Äôs a productivity powerhouse hiding in plain sight. Most people only scratch the surface of what it can do, but with the right tricks, you can automate repetitive tasks, speed up communication, and reclaim hours every week.

Here are **10 Microsoft 365 hacks** that can help you save *at least* an hour a day.

## 1. Use Quick Steps in Outlook

If you find yourself performing the same email actions repeatedly (move to folder, reply, forward, etc.), Quick Steps can do it in one click. For example, you can set up a Quick Step that automatically forwards an email to your manager, marks it as read, and files it away.

**Where to find it:** Outlook ‚Üí Home ‚Üí Quick Steps.

## 2. Schedule Emails in Outlook

Instead of clogging up someone‚Äôs inbox late at night, schedule your emails to send at the perfect time. This is especially useful for working across time zones.

**How:** In Outlook, compose your email ‚Üí Options ‚Üí Delay Delivery ‚Üí Set time.

## 3. Use @Mentions in Emails & Teams

Tired of long threads where nobody knows who should act? Just type `@Name` in Outlook or Teams, and it‚Äôll tag that person, highlight their name, and even add them to the ‚ÄúTo‚Äù field automatically.

## 4. Speed Up Documents with Templates in Word & PowerPoint

Stop reinventing the wheel. Save frequently used proposals, reports, or presentations as templates so you can start with a polished base every time.

**How:** File ‚Üí Save As ‚Üí Word Template or PowerPoint Template.

## 5. Master OneNote for Meeting Notes

OneNote integrates with Outlook and Teams so you can capture meeting notes that link directly to calendar invites. You can even tag action items and assign them instantly.

## 6. Automate Repetitive Tasks with Power Automate

Think of Power Automate as your personal assistant. You can create workflows like:

- Saving email attachments directly to OneDrive.
- Notifying Teams when a new SharePoint file is uploaded.
- Sending reminders before deadlines.

## 7. Use Dictation Instead of Typing

Whether you‚Äôre in Word, Outlook, or PowerPoint, you can dictate your thoughts instead of typing them out. It‚Äôs surprisingly accurate and much faster for drafting emails or notes.

**Where:** Home ‚Üí Dictate.

## 8. Turn Excel Data into Insights Instantly

Instead of spending hours on formulas, let Excel do the heavy lifting. Use the ‚ÄúAnalyze Data‚Äù button (formerly ‚ÄúIdeas‚Äù) to generate pivot tables, charts, and summaries instantly.

## 9. Use Teams Keyboard Shortcuts

Navigating Teams with your mouse is slow. Use shortcuts like:

- `Ctrl + E`
‚Üí Jump to the search bar.
- `Ctrl + Shift + M`
‚Üí Mute/unmute.
- `Ctrl + 1`
‚Üí Switch to Activity tab.

These little shortcuts add up to big time savings.

## 10. Collaborate in Real-Time with Share Links

Instead of emailing attachments back and forth, share your Word, Excel, or PowerPoint files via OneDrive or SharePoint. Everyone edits the same document, and you never waste time merging versions.

Microsoft 365 is designed to make work easier, but only if you know how to unlock its features. By using these 10 hacks, you can streamline your workflow, reduce busywork, and free up at least an hour a day to focus on what really matters.
